value.name: WEEK IN NEWS: Street stabbing, back to class, shot scholarships
value.description: Road rage: A Brooklyn man was nearly eviscerated in a fight over a parking spot on a public street in Queens, police said Monday. Gregory Williams, 48, was knifed in the stomach, arm and back because he moved orange traffic cones that Anthony Thomas used to illegally block off a section of Laurelton last Sunday,

value.name: Queens man stabs driver with kitchen knife in spat over parking space, leaving victim clinging to life
